title: How to do blog commenting - Quora

response.answer_text: I think the most annoying thing that happens when someone comments is a clear lack of actually reading the article. I have one post that people come to from Google and ask to have their link added to the post, which I don’t mind at all because I want that post to be an amazing resource. But the problem is, people come, post their link, and usually make some comment that shows they didn’t really read the article to begin with. So here are my top 3 suggestions: Use the writer’s name. Don’t assume it’s the owner of the blog either. It might be a guest post. Take a few seconds to view the author’s name or check for a notice that the post is a guest post.Actually read the article and comment on a specific point. Shows you actually took the time to read it and you’re not just there to drop a link. Especially useful if you’re looking to work with that blog in the future.Continue the conversation. Ask a question or share a similar story from your own life. This promotes engagement from other comments and the blog author. It’s a surefire way to make sure your comment is noticed. is a sea of others.Those are my best tips, but if you’d like, you can check out my full list of ways to write better comments. Hope this clarifies the process for you!
